II. Purpose of Addendum
Adams House is located on the campus of Crossroads for Youth. Crossroads for
Youth renovated Adams House and is requesting approval to use it as a Child
Caring Institution to service abuse and neglect residents.
III. Methodology
12/20/2013 Environmental inspection Rating - A
09/23/2014 Fire inspection Rating – A
10/24/2014 Toured Adams House
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
Crossroads for Youth will provide services at Adams House to abuse and neglect,
female wards 11-17 years of age. Residents will receive social skills development,
community service, individual counseling, family counseling, and therapy groups
(substance abuse, anger management and trauma recovery). Residents will also
attend school on campus at Deer Trail Academy.
Adams House has a capacity for 12 residents. A full kitchen, dining room, recreation
room, living room, laundry room and staff offices are on the first floor. The residents
will have shared bedrooms (two to four residents in each bedroom) and a private
bathroom with a tub and a multiple person use bathroom stalls, sinks and showers
on the second floor. Adams House does not have a basement.
Crossroads for Youth will utilize their current Child Caring Institution social service
supervisor, social service worker and direct care worker to staff Adams House.
V. Recommendation
It is recommended for Adams House to be added to Crossroads for Youth’s Child
Caring Institution license.
